medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset of stroke-like symptoms including headache and left hemiparesis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 6.5 hours prior to arrival, starting with abrupt headache and left arm tingling ('ants crawling'). Progression over the first hour included dysarthria, dysphagia, and left lower extremity paresthesias. By neurologic consultation, the patient reported some subjective improvement in left leg sensory deficits but continued to be weak throughout the left hemibody.
medical_history.past_medical_history: B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) diagnosed 3 months prior; underwent induction chemotherapy with multiple agents and was receiving consolidation chemotherapy. Most recent lumbar puncture with IT-MTX was 10 days prior, showing stable CSF analysis.
medical_history.social_history: Denies current tobacco, alcohol, or drug use.
